meanings.sent1: Before starting the presentation, she preinserted the key points into the slides.
meanings.sent2: The teacher always preinserts the answers to the quiz questions to save time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel preinserted acorns in the tree trunk for a surprise snack later.
meanings.sent4: She preinserted her thoughts into the conversation, guiding it in a new direction.
meanings.sent5: The detective preinserted clues throughout the crime scene to lead to the culprit.

meanings.definition: The act of inserting or placing beforehand
meanings.sent1: His preinserting of the documents made the meeting run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The preinserting of the ingredients into the recipe saved time in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The preinserting of jokes into his speech made the audience laugh before he even started.
meanings.sent4: Her preinserting of emotions into her artwork gave it a deeper meaning.
meanings.sent5: The preinserting of seeds into the soil ensured a bountiful harvest in the garden.
